name: Metropole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 5 nights at the Metropole. Everything was very comfortable and enjoyable. We had booked a promo rate offered at the latter part of October which was about half what friends paid in Sept. Our room did not have a seaview and was at the end next to the road overlooking it as well as the pool and garden. Not a sound from the traffic on the road could be heard due to double heavy windows/doors out to a balcony. The room was not large but the bed was very large and very comfortable. The bathroom was very modern though not much counter space, however adequate for our needs. Towels twice a day if needed.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and location

likes.liked: — Closeness to town and transportation as well as old world charm
likes.disliked: — The uphill walk back to hotel!

reviews.title: Beautiful great hotel, but a little musty
reviews.text: We certainly did not notice any musty smell so must not have been in the area of the previous writer and my husband who has asthma, too, had no difficulties.
The lobby and lounge area is very comfortable with the Herald Tribune available to read every day. One can order tea or coffee served from the bar in the afternoon or evening.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Outstanding Location

reviews.text: The dining room is beautiful with crystal chandeliers. The breakfast was very good including champagne (or perhaps Sekt) as well a juices, eggs,bacon,cold cuts and cheeses, lots of breads/rolls, lovely baked pears and apples as well as fresh fruit, yogurts and of course cereals along with coffee, capaccino, tea or chocolate. Very acceptible!.
reviews.title: The Hotel Metropole- so accomodating

reviews.text: We were in Europe for 6 weeks & our 2 nights at this hotel were a highlight. The reception staff spoke good english & were very welcoming & encouraged to take up their 1/2 board option. We usually prefer to eat in local restaurants but economically the option seemed too good to turn down. We were then shown our lovely clean & spacious rooms which were exactly as booked - water view rooms in the Villa overlooking the sea.
reviews.title: An Amazing Stay

reviews.text: The dinner each night was silver service & food was excellent. It was great value & we were sad to leave this very welcoming hotel.
reviews.title: Out-of-season Italian Riviera visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Santa Margharita Ligure is a perfect base for exploration of the Italian Riviera. Portofino is just a short bus drive away (do not use a car) and it is also easy to explore Cinque Terre from there.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a family-owned property smack in the middle of tthe town. A parking is available and the property also has a park with a swimming pool. The rooms were correctly furnished and well-appointed, although somwehat overheated for the period of the year (opening a window helps). Beautiful postcard views from the windows, small balconies.
reviews.title: A little bit of heaven.....

likes.liked: — Great views, great access to the sea and wonderful staff
likes.disliked: — Our end room had street noise that you wouldn't have if you had a sea view room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very good and English is well spoken.
reviews.title: excellent choice
Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: What a wonderful place. Families of all ages, warm staff, spotless room, double-paned windows to block out the constant din of scooter noise! We loved the breakfast on the patio, the lounge chairs practically IN the ocean, the oceanfront restaurant. This hotel is truly walking distance from the train station (2 minutes away - downhill!) and we can't wait to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Metropole after reading the reviews on this site and was thrilled to find that the best reviews were true! The hotel property is gorgeous -- beautiful garden, lovely terrace, wonderful pool and ocean-side layout area (complete with comfortable chairs, umbrellas, etc). The staff also was extremely welcoming, nice, and helpful. In fact, I forgot my favorite pillow at the hotel, and they were nice enough to find it and mail it back to me! Metropole really is a cut above the rest, and I will not hesitate to come back again.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.liked: — The gorgeous grounds and attentive staff

reviews.text: The hotel was stunning in every respect. The bedroom was in the Villa part and had the most beautiful views over the sea. It was clean with of course and Italian style.
reviews.title: Will definately return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel gardens were adorable, the smell of the flowers was wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Just superb-a haven of peace and tranquility
reviews.text: Just returned from this hotel and really loved it. We were celebrating our 28th wedding anniversary and having extensive experience of hotels in Italy and elsewhere we cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We stayed in the annexe down by the water and had the delight of a stroll through the manicured gardens to breakfast. (If it rains there is a covered walkway.) The room was very traditional but in the most modern of ways-lovely bed linen and towels and turndown service every night. It was like staying in a private house with super service. Sunbathing was a delight with pristine clean showers and loos and lovely fluffy lemon beach towels. The lifeguards worked constantly, maintaining the areas and were positively welcoming as you arrived each day( no charge--what a saving!)

reviews.title: Charming place
reviews.text: We only breakfasted each morning as we were having fun checking out the restaurants of the area but breakfast was excellent. The hotel is beautifully situated on the sea side of the approach road to the town so you have direct access to the shore and a super view of the boats,ferrys and yachts.

reviews.title: Nice hotel in a quaint town (3.5 out of 5)
reviews.text: If you like noisy,brash and loud hotels , dont stay here-it is for total peace and old fashioned class. I am already planning our next trip in spring next year.
Best restaurant for simple food-beautifully cooked and served by super staff -Restaurant Michele--Bush is the head waiter and is just lovely-very truthful when you ask advice!
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Metropole, what a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stop in Italy after driving from Nice. Santa Margherita is a lovely place with lots of charm. It is more "real" than Portofino just down the road. We stayed at the Hotel Metropole which had a great deal with Orbitz. Our room was in the red annex and looked out over the water. We could hear the waves lapping the shore at night but because of unusually warm weather we had a few mosquitos visit through the open windows. Breakfast was a tremendous buffet with everything you could possibly want--lots of hot and cold choices. Staff was courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Great if you're over 65!

description: Traditional hotel dating from 1900 with modern amenities; situated in a serene garden setting with private beach, facing the sea.
